page.title: 14HERONTYE HOUSE
page.content: Herontye House off Stuart Way, East Grinstead is a magnificent manor house built in 1912 for $30000. It is now a listed building. It was originally built on an 1q acre site and stone used in the mullions and archways was quarried nearby. The house was built by H & E Waters of Forest Row, still a thriving business in 1985. Lord Glendyne moved into the house in 1926 and in 1972, following his death,the estate was sold to Wates, a major building firm, for housing development Herontye House now has an acre garden and is the headquarters of the international consulting engineers BMMK Cotterell. It is a typical example of the grounds of a large house being used for smaller housing units. The old house is now surrounded by houses, cars, children, washing lines etc. instead of trees & fields.
